body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--006a51241073e994b41acfe9ec718e94-->
### Code Coverage
For detailed information about the code coverage, see the [test coverage report](https://corecheck.dev/bitcoin/bitcoin/pulls/30193).
<!--021abf342d371248e50ceaed478a90ca-->
### Reviews
See [the guideline](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#code-review) for information on the review process.
| Type | Reviewers |
| ---- | --------- |
| Concept ACK | [maflcko](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30193#issuecomment-2137638765), [hebasto](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30193#issuecomment-2137644075), [0xB10C](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30193#issuecomment-2139206624) |

If your review is incorrectly listed, please react with ð to this comment and the bot will ignore it on the next update.
<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#30164](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30164) ([PoC] ci: Add FreeBSD GitHub Actions job by hebasto)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.
Concept ACK, may review tomorrow if GHA is back online by then.

Question: Do we want to keep this job whole or split parts out (such as just running the USDT tests)?

If we are keeping it whole as it is with ASAN and LSAN etc, I will investigate if we can get the IPV6 tests working. If I can't get them working, I would like to update the python IPV6 check as it's currently passing even though IPV6 isn't working on the runner.
Is a single job chosen for a reson here? The free hosted GHA runners have 4 (v)CPUs available AFAIK...
diff_hunk:
@@ -308,3 +308,40 @@ jobs:
           BITCOINFUZZ: "${{ github.workspace}}\\src\\fuzz.exe"
         shell: cmd
         run: py -3 test\fuzz\test_runner.py --par %NUMBER_OF_PROCESSORS% --loglevel DEBUG %RUNNER_TEMP%\qa-assets\fuzz_seed_corpus
+
+  asan-lsan-ubsan-integer-no-depends-usdt:
+    name: 'ASan + LSan + UBSan + integer, no depends, USDT'
+    runs-on: ubuntu-24.04
+    # No need to run on the read-only mirror, unless it is a PR.
+    if: github.repository != 'bitcoin-core/gui' || github.event_name == 'pull_request'
+    timeout-minutes: 120
+    env:
+      FILE_ENV: "./ci/test/00_setup_env_native_asan.sh"
+      CIRRUS_CI: true
+      TEST_RUNNER_EXTRA: --exclude "rpc_bind.py --ipv6,feature_proxy.py"
+      MAKEJOBS: '-j1'

body: I have been hitting issues on github actions runners cancelling the job after 4 minutes ,which is during compile, so this was an attempt to reduce the CPU load. It hasn't helped. See https://github.com/actions/runner-images/issues/9848#issuecomment-2137525256
diff_hunk:
@@ -308,3 +308,40 @@ jobs:
           BITCOINFUZZ: "${{ github.workspace}}\\src\\fuzz.exe"
         shell: cmd
         run: py -3 test\fuzz\test_runner.py --par %NUMBER_OF_PROCESSORS% --loglevel DEBUG %RUNNER_TEMP%\qa-assets\fuzz_seed_corpus
+
+  asan-lsan-ubsan-integer-no-depends-usdt:
+    name: 'ASan + LSan + UBSan + integer, no depends, USDT'
+    runs-on: ubuntu-24.04
+    # No need to run on the read-only mirror, unless it is a PR.
+    if: github.repository != 'bitcoin-core/gui' || github.event_name == 'pull_request'
+    timeout-minutes: 120
+    env:
+      FILE_ENV: "./ci/test/00_setup_env_native_asan.sh"
+      CIRRUS_CI: true
+      TEST_RUNNER_EXTRA: --exclude "rpc_bind.py --ipv6,feature_proxy.py"
+      MAKEJOBS: '-j1'

body: Concept ACK! Thanks for working on this!
Please remove the Cirrus task in the same commit, to make review easier.
@maflcko @hebasto @fanquake do we want to just extract the USDT part of the job into Github Actions?
Not sure. It seems more work and overhead to maintain two tasks, instead of one, no?
Well, if you really wanted to do it, you could move it into the "test each commit" task, and make that one run every time, to keep the number of tasks the same.
Please clarify in the name that this was set up for CI
diff_hunk:
@@ -29,6 +29,8 @@ if [ -z "$DANGER_RUN_CI_ON_HOST" ]; then
   docker volume create "${CONTAINER_NAME}_depends_SDKs_android" || true
   docker volume create "${CONTAINER_NAME}_previous_releases" || true
 
+  docker network create --ipv6 --subnet 2001:0DB8::/112 ip6net || true

body:
I don't think this works, does it? installation happens when the image is built (`docker build`), not when the tests are compiled and run.

See the Cirrus CI comment:

```
   # In the image build step, no external environment variables are available,
    # so any settings will need to be written to the settings env file:

diff_hunk:
@@ -20,7 +22,7 @@ export CONTAINER_NAME=ci_native_asan
 export PACKAGES="systemtap-sdt-dev clang-18 llvm-18 libclang-rt-18-dev python3-zmq qtbase5-dev qttools5-dev-tools libevent-dev libboost-dev libdb5.3++-dev libminiupnpc-dev libnatpmp-dev libzmq3-dev libqrencode-dev libsqlite3-dev ${BPFCC_PACKAGE}"
 export NO_DEPENDS=1
 export GOAL="install"
-export BITCOIN_CONFIG="--enable-usdt --enable-zmq --with-incompatible-bdb --with-gui=qt5 \
+export BITCOIN_CONFIG="--enable-usdt --enable-zmq --with-incompatible-bdb --with-gui=no --enable-fuzz-binary=no --disable-bench \

body: Also, it could split this up into a separate commit/pull, as this affects more than just this one task?

   docker volume create "${CONTAINER_NAME}_depends_SDKs_android" || true
   docker volume create "${CONTAINER_NAME}_previous_releases" || true
 
+  docker network create --ipv6 --subnet 2001:0DB8::/112 ip6net || true

body: I was under the impression that these things were not relevant for these sanitisation tests but if they are I will add them back in.

body: The gui tests and benchmarks should also be running under the sanitizer, otherwise bugs may be missed in them.

body: Oh you are right. This was a late change after I had already had the USDT tests running and didn't check that they were still running ð¤¦
